Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:2: Lo! We have revealed the Scripture unto thee (Muhammad) with truth; so worship Allah, making religion pure for Him (only).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:3: Surely pure religion is for Allah only.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:4: If Allah had willed to choose a son, He could have chosen what He would of that which He hath created.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:5: He hath created the heavens and the earth with truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:6: He created you from one being, then from that (being) He made its mate; and He hath provided for you of cattle eight kinds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:7: If ye are thankless, yet Allah is Independent of you, though He is not pleased with thanklessness for His bondmen; and if ye are thankful He is pleased therewith for you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:8: And when some hurt toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning unto Him (repentant).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:9: Is he who payeth adoration in the watches of the night, prostrate and standing, bewaring of the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, (to be accounted equal with a disbeliever) ? Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Are those who know equal with those who know not ? But only men of understanding will pay heed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:10: Say: O My bondmen who believe! Observe your duty to your Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:11: Say (O Muhammad): Lo! I am commanded to worship Allah, making religion pure for Him (only).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:12: And I am commanded to be the first of those who are muslims (surrender unto Him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:13: Say: Lo! if I should disobey my Lord, I fear the doom of a tremendous Day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:14: Say: Allah I worship, making my religion pure for Him (only).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:15: Then worship what ye will beside Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:16: They have an awning of fire above them and beneath them a dais (of fire).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:17: And those who put away false gods lest they should worship them and turn to Allah in repentance, for them there are glad tidings.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:18: Who hear advice and follow the best thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:19: Is he on whom the word of doom is fulfilled (to be helped), and canst thou (O Muhammad) rescue him who is in the Fire ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:20: But those who keep their duty to their Lord, for them are lofty halls with lofty halls above them, built (for them), beneath which rivers flow.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:21: Hast thou not seen how Allah hath sent down water from the sky and hath caused it to penetrate the earth as watersprings, and afterward thereby produceth crops of divers hues; and afterward they wither and thou seest them turn yellow; then He maketh them chaff.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:22: Is he whose bosom Allah hath expanded for Al-Islam, so that he followeth a light from his Lord, (as he who disbelieveth) ? Then woe unto those whose hearts are hardened against remembrance of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:23: Allah hath (now) revealed the fairest of statements, a Scripture consistent, (wherein promises of reward are) paired (with threats of punishment), whereat doth creep the flesh of those who fear their Lord, so that their flesh and their hearts soften to Allah’s reminder.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:24: Is he then, who will strike his face against the awful doom upon the Day of Resurrection (as he who doeth right) ? And it will be said unto the wrong-doers: Taste what ye used to earn.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:25: Those before them denied, and so the doom came on them whence they knew not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:26: Thus Allah made them taste humiliation in the life of the world, and verily the doom of the Hereafter will be greater if they did but know.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:27: And verily We have coined for mankind in this Qur’an all kinds of similitudes, that haply they may reflect;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:28: A Lecture in Arabic, containing no crookedness, that haply they may ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:29: Allah coineth a similitude: A man in relation to whom are several part-owners, quarrelling, and a man belonging wholly to one man.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:30: Lo! thou wilt die, and lo! they will die;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:31: Then lo! on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord ye will dispute.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:32: And who doth greater wrong than he who telleth a lie against Allah, and denieth the truth when it reacheth him ? Will not the home of disbelievers be in hell ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:33: And whoso bringeth the truth and believeth therein - Such are the dutiful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:34: They shall have what they will of their Lord’s bounty.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:35: That Allah will remit from them the worst of what they did, and will pay them for reward the best they used to do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:36: Will not Allah defend His slave ? Yet they would frighten thee with those beside Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:37: And he whom Allah guideth, for him there can be no misleader.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:38: And verily, if thou shouldst ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth ? they will say: Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:39: Say: O my people! Act in your manner.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:40: Who it is unto whom cometh a doom that will abase him, and on whom there falleth everlasting doom
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:41: Lo! We have revealed unto thee (Muhammad) the Scripture for mankind with truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:42: Allah receiveth (men’s) souls at the time of their death, and that (soul) which dieth not (yet) in its sleep.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:43: Or choose they intercessors other than Allah ? Say: What! Even though they have power over nothing and have no intelligence ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:44: Say: Unto Allah belongeth all intercession.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:45: And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter are repelled, and when those (whom they worship) beside Him are mentioned, behold! they are glad.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:46: Say: O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of the Invisible and the Visible! Thou wilt judge between Thy slaves concerning that wherein they used to differ.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:47: And though those who do wrong possess all that is in the earth, and therewith as much again, they verily will seek to ransom themselves therewith on the Day of Resurrection from the awful doom; and there will appear unto them, from their Lord, that wherewith they never reckoned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:48: And the evils that they earned will appear unto them, and that whereat they used to scoff will surround them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:49: Now when hurt toucheth a man he crieth unto Us, and afterward when We have granted him a boon from Us, he saith: Only by force of knowledge I obtained it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:50: Those before them said it, yet (all) that they had earned availed them not;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:51: But the evils that they earned smote them; and such of these as do wrong, the evils that they earn will smite them; they cannot escape.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:52: Know they not that Allah enlargeth providence for whom He will, and straiteneth it (for whom He will).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:53: Say: O My slaves who have been prodigal to their own hurt! Despair not of the mercy of Allah, Who forgiveth all sins.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:54: Turn unto your Lord repentant, and surrender unto Him, before there come unto you the doom, when ye cannot be helped.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:55: And follow the better (guidance) of that which is revealed unto you from your Lord, before the doom cometh on you suddenly when ye know not,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:56: Lest any soul should say: Alas, my grief that I was unmindful of Allah, and I was indeed among the scoffers!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:57: Or should say: If Allah had but guided me I should have been among the dutiful!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:58: Or should say, when it seeth the doom: Oh, that I had but a second chance that I might be among the righteous!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:59: (But now the answer will be): Nay, for My revelations came unto thee, but thou didst deny them and wast scornful and wast among the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:60: And on the Day of Resurrection thou (Muhammad) seest those who lied concerning Allah with their faces blackened.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:61: And Allah delivereth those who ward off (evil) because of their deserts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:62: Allah is Creator of all things, and He is Guardian over all things.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:63: His are the keys of the heavens and the earth, and they who disbelieve the revelations of Allah - such are they who are the losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:64: Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): Do ye bid me serve other than Allah ? O ye fools!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:65: And verily it hath been revealed unto thee as unto those before thee (saying): If thou ascribe a partner to Allah thy work will fail and thou indeed wilt be among the losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:66: Nay, but Allah must thou serve, and be among the thankful!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:67: And they esteem not Allah as He hath the right to be esteemed, when the whole earth is His handful on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens are rolled in His right hand.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:68: And the trumpet is blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are in the earth swoon away, save him whom Allah willeth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:69: And the earth shineth with the light of her Lord, and the Book is set up, and the prophets and the witnesses are brought, and it is judged between them with truth, and they are not wronged.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:70: And each soul is paid in full for what it did.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:71: And those who disbelieve are driven unto hell in troops till, when they reach it and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Came there not unto you messengers of your own, reciting unto you the revelations of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this your Day ? they say: Yea, verily.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:72: It is said (unto them): Enter ye the gates of hell to dwell therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:73: And those who keep their duty to their Lord are driven unto the Garden in troops till, when they reach it, and the gates thereof are opened, and the warders thereof say unto them: Peace be unto you! Ye are good, so enter ye (the Garden of delight), to dwell therein;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:74: They say: Praise be to Allah, Who hath fulfilled His promise unto us and hath made us inherit the land, sojourning in the Garden where we will! So bounteous is the wage of workers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 39:75: And thou (O Muhammad) seest the angels thronging round the Throne, hymning the praises of their Lord.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:1: The revelation of this Book is from God, the Exalted in Power, full of Wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:2: Verily it is We Who have revealed the Book to thee in Truth: so serve God, offering Him sincere devotion.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:3: Is it not to God that sincere devotion is due? But those who take for protectors other than God (say): "We only serve them in order that they may bring us nearer to God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:4: Had God wished to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen whom He pleased out of those whom He doth create: but Glory be to Him! (He is above such things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:5: He created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions): He makes the Night overlap the Day, and the Day overlap the Night: He has subjected the sun and the moon (to His law): Each one follows a course for a time appointed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:6: He created you (all) from a single person: then created, of like nature, his mate; and he sent down for you eight head of cattle in pairs: He makes you, in the wombs of your mothers, in stages, one after another, in three veils of darkness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:7: If ye reject (God), Truly God hath no need of you; but He liketh not ingratitude from His servants: if ye are grateful, He is pleased with you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:8: When some trouble toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning to Him in repentance: but when He bestoweth a favour upon him as from Himself, (man) doth forget what he cried and prayed for before, and he doth set up rivals unto God, thus misleading others from God’s Path.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:9: Is one who worships devoutly during the hour of the night prostrating himself or standing (in adoration), who takes heed of the Hereafter, and who places his hope in the Mercy of his Lord - (like one who does not)? Say: "Are those equal, those who know and those who do not know? It is those who are endued with understanding that receive admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:10: Say: "O ye my servants who believe! Fear your Lord, good is (the reward) for those who do good in this world.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:11: Say: "Verily, I am commanded to serve God with sincere devotion;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:12: "And I am commanded to be the first of those who bow to God in Islam.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:13: Say: "I would, if I disobeyed my Lord, indeed have fear of the Penalty of a Mighty Day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:14: Say: "It is God I serve, with my sincere (and exclusive) devotion:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:15: "Serve ye what ye will besides him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:16: They shall have Layers of Fire above them, and Layers (of Fire) below them: with this doth God warn off his servants: "O My Servants! then fear ye Me!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:17: Those who eschew Evil,- and fall not into its worship,- and turn to God (in repentance),- for them is Good News: so announce the Good News to My Servants,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:18: Those who listen to the Word, and follow the best (meaning) in it: those are the ones whom God has guided, and those are the ones endued with understanding.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:19: Is, then, one against whom the decree of Punishment is justly due (equal to one who eschews Evil)? Wouldst thou, then, deliver one (who is) in the Fire?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:20: But it is for those who fear their Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:21: Seest thou not that God sends down rain from the sky, and leads it through springs in the earth? Then He causes to grow, therewith, produce of various colours: then it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then He makes it dry up and crumble away.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:22: Is one whose heart God has opened to Islam, so that he has received Enlightenment from God, (no better than one hard-hearted)? Woe to those whose hearts are hardened against celebrating the praises of God! they are manifestly wandering (in error)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:23: God has revealed (from time to time) the most beautiful Message in the form of a Book, consistent with itself, (yet) repeating (its teaching in various aspects): the skins of those who fear their Lord tremble thereat; then their skins and their hearts do soften to the celebration of God’s praises.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:24: Is, then, one who has to fear the brunt of the Penalty on the Day of Judgment (and receive it) on his face, (like one guarded therefrom)? It will be said to the wrong-doers: "Taste ye (the fruits of) what ye earned!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:25: Those before them (also) rejected (revelation), and so the Punishment came to them from directions they did not perceive.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:26: So God gave them a taste of humiliation in the present life, but greater is the punishment of the Hereafter, if they only knew!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:27: We have put forth for men, in this Qur’an every kind of Parable, in order that they may receive admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:28: (It is) a Qur’an in Arabic, without any crookedness (therein): in order that they may guard against Evil.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:29: God puts forth a Parable a man belonging to many partners at variance with each other, and a man belonging entirely to one master: are those two equal in comparison? Praise be to God! but most of them have no knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:30: Truly thou wilt die (one day), and truly they (too) will die (one day).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:31: In the end will ye (all), on the Day of Judgment, settle your disputes in the presence of your Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:32: Who, then, doth more wrong than one who utters a lie concerning God, and rejects the Truth when it comes to him; is there not in Hell an abode for blasphemers?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:33: And he who brings the Truth and he who confirms (and supports) it - such are the men who do right.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:34: They shall have all that they wish for, in the presence of their Lord: such is the reward of those who do good:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:35: So that God will turn off from them (even) the worst in their deeds and give them their reward according to the best of what they have done.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:36: Is not God enough for his Servant? But they try to frighten thee with other (gods) besides Him! for such as God leaves to stray, there can be no guide.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:37: And such as God doth guide there can be none to lead astray.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:38: If indeed thou ask them who it is that created the heavens and the earth, they would be sure to say, "God".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:39: Say: "O my People! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): but soon will ye know-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:40: "Who it is to whom comes a Penalty of ignominy, and on whom descends a Penalty that abides.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:41: Verily We have revealed the Book to thee in Truth, for (instructing) mankind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:42: It is God that takes the souls (of men) at death; and those that die not (He takes) during their sleep: those on whom He has passed the decree of death, He keeps back (from returning to life), but the rest He sends (to their bodies) for a term appointed verily in this are Signs for those who reflect.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:43: What! Do they take for intercessors others besides God? Say: "Even if they have no power whatever and no intelligence?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:44: Say: "To God belongs exclusively (the right to grant) intercession: to Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: In the End, it is to Him that ye shall be brought back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:45: When God, the One and Only, is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter are filled with disgust and horror; but when (gods) other than He are mentioned, behold, they are filled with joy!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:46: Say: "O God! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of all that is hidden and open! it is Thou that wilt judge between Thy Servants in those matters about which they have differed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:47: Even if the wrong-doers had all that there is on earth, and as much more, (in vain) would they offer it for ransom from the pain of the Penalty on the Day of Judgment: but something will confront them from God, which they could never have counted upon!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:48: For the evils of their Deeds will confront them, and they will be (completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:49: Now, when trouble touches man, he cries to Us: But when We bestow a favour upon him as from Ourselves, he says, "This has been given to me because of a certain knowledge (I have)!" Nay, but this is but a trial, but most of them understand not!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:50: Thus did the (generations) before them say! But all that they did was of no profit to them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:51: Nay, the evil results of their Deeds overtook them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:52: Know they not that God enlarges the provision or restricts it, for any He pleases? Verily, in this are Signs for those who believe!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:53: Say: "O my Servants who have transgressed against their souls! Despair not of the Mercy of God: for God forgives all sins: for He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:54: "Turn ye to our Lord (in repentance) and bow to His (Will), before the Penalty comes on you: after that ye shall not be helped.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:55: "And follow the best of (the courses) revealed to you from your Lord, before the Penalty comes on you - of a sudden while ye perceive not!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:56: "Lest the soul should (then) say: ’Ah! Woe is me!- In that I neglected (my duty) towards God, and was but among those who mocked!’-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:57: "Or (lest) it should say: ’If only God had guided me, I should certainly have been among the righteous!’-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:58: "Or (lest) it should say when it (actually) sees the penalty: ’If only I had another chance, I should certainly be among those who do good!’
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:59: "(The reply will be:) ’Nay, but there came to thee my Signs, and thou didst reject them: thou wast Haughty, and became one of those who reject faith!’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:60: On the Day of Judgment wilt thou see those who told lies against God;- their faces will be turned black; Is there not in Hell an abode for the Haughty?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:61: But God will deliver the righteous to their place of salvation: no evil shall touch them, nor shall they grieve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:62: God is the Creator of all things, and He is the Guardian and Disposer of all affairs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:63: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: and those who reject the Signs of God,- it is they who will be in loss.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:64: Say: "Is it some one other than God that ye order me to worship, O ye ignorant ones?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:65: But it has already been revealed to thee,- as it was to those before thee,- "If thou wert to join (gods with God), truly fruitless will be thy work (in life), and thou wilt surely be in the ranks of those who lose (all spiritual good)".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:66: Nay, but worship God, and be of those who give thanks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:67: No just estimate have they made of God, such as is due to Him: On the Day of Judgment the whole of the earth will be but His handful, and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand: Glory to Him! High is He above the Partners they attribute to Him!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:68: The Trumpet will (just) be sounded, when all that are in the heavens and on earth will swoon, except such as it will please God (to exempt).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:69: And the Earth will shine with the Glory of its Lord: the Record (of Deeds) will be placed (open); the prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward and a just decision pronounced between them; and they will not be wronged (in the least).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:70: And to every soul will be paid in full (the fruit) of its Deeds; and (God) knoweth best all that they do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:71: The Unbelievers will be led to Hell in crowd: until, when they arrive, there, its gates will be opened.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:72: (To them) will be said: "Enter ye the gates of Hell, to dwell therein: and evil is (this) Abode of the Arrogant!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:73: And those who feared their Lord will be led to the Garden in crowds: until behold, they arrive there; its gates will be opened; and its keepers will say: "Peace be upon you! well have ye done! enter ye here, to dwell therein.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:74: They will say: "Praise be to God, Who has truly fulfilled His Promise to us, and has given us (this) land in heritage: We can dwell in the Garden as we will: how excellent a reward for those who work (righteousness)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 39:75: And thou wilt see the angels surrounding the Throne (Divine) on all sides, singing Glory and Praise to their Lord.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:1: The sending down of the Book is from God the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:2: We have sent down to thee the Book with the truth; so worship God, making thy religion His sincerely.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:3: Belongs not sincere religion to God? And those who take protectors, apart from Him -- ’We only serve them that they may bring us nigh in nearness to God’ -- surely God shall judge between them touching that whereon they are at variance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:4: Had God desired to take to Him a son, He would have chosen whatever He willed of that He has created.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:5: He created the heavens and the earth in truth, wrapping night about the day, and wrapping the day about the night; and He has subjected the sun and the moon, each of them running to a stated term.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:6: He created you of a single soul, then from it He appointed its mate; and He sent down to you of the cattle eight couples.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:7: If you are unthankful, God is independent of you, yet He approves not unthankfulness in His servants; but if you are thankful, He will approve it in you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:8: When some affliction visits a man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to him; then when He confers on him a blessing from Him he forgets that he was calling to before and sets up compeers to God, to lead astray from His way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:9: Or is he who is obedient in the watches of the night, bowing himself and standing, he being afraid of the world to come and hoping for the mercy of his Lord .
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:10: Say: ’My servants who believe, fear your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:11: Say: ’I have been commanded to serve God making my religion His sincerely;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:12: and I have been commanded to be the first of those that surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:13: Say: ’Truly I fear, if I should rebel against my Lord, the chastisement of a dreadful day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:14: Say: ’God I serve, making my religion His sincerely;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:15: so serve what you will apart from Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:16: Above them they shall have overshadowings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:17: Those who eschew the serving of idols and turn penitent to God, for them is good tidings! So give thou good tidings to My servants
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:18: who give ear to the Word and follow the fairest of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:19: He against whom the word of chastisement is realized -- shalt thou deliver him out of the Fire?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:20: But those who fear their Lord -- for them await lofty chambers, above which are built lofty chambers, underneath which rivers flow -- God’s promise; God fails not the tryst.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:21: Hast thou not seen how that God has sent down out of heaven water and threaded it as springs in the earth, then He brings forth therewith crops of diverse hues, then they wither, and thou seest them turning yellow, then He makes them broken orts? Surely in that is a reminder for men possessed of minds.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:22: Is he whose breast God has expanded unto Islam, so he walks in a light from his Lord .
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:23: God has sent down the fairest discourse as a Book, consimilar in its oft-repeated, whereat shiver the skins of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts soften to the remembrance of God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:24: Is he who guards himself with his face against the evil of the chastisement on the Day of Resurrection .
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:25: Those that were before them cried lies, then the chastisement came upon them from whence they were not aware;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:26: so God let them taste degradation in this present life; and the chastisement of the world to come is assuredly greater, did they but know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:27: Indeed We have struck for the people in this Koran every manner of similitude; haply they will remember;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:28: Koran, wherein there is no crookedness; haply they will be godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:29: God has struck a similitude -- a man in whom partners disagreeing share, and a man the property of one man.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:30: Thou art mortal, and they are mortal;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:31: then on the Day of Resurrection before your Lord you shall dispute.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:32: But who does greater evil than he who lies against God and cries lies to the very truth, when it comes to him? Is there not in Gehenna a lodging for the unbelievers?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:33: And he who has come with the very truth and confirms it, those they are the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:34: They shall have whatsoever they will with their Lord; that is the recompense of the good-doers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:35: that God may acquit them of the worst of what they did, and recompense them with the wages of the fairest of what they were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:36: Shall not God suffice His servant, though they frighten thee with those apart from Him? And whomsoever God leads astray, no guide has he.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:37: But whomso God guides, none shall lead him astray; is not God All-mighty, All-vengeful?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:38: If thou askest them, ’Who created the heavens and the earth?’ they will say, ’God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:39: Say: ’My people, act according to your station; I am acting; and soon you will know
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:40: to whom will come a chastisement degrading him, and upon whom lights a lasting chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:41: Surely We have sent down upon thee the Book for mankind with the truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:42: God takes the souls at the time of their death, and that which has not died, in its sleep; He withholds that against which He has decreed death, but looses the other till a stated term.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:43: Say: ’What, even though they have no power whatever and no understanding?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:45: When God is mentioned alone, then shudder the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter, but when those apart from Him are mentioned behold, they rejoice.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:46: Say: ’O God, Thou originator of the heavens and the earth who knowest the Unseen and the Visible, Thou shalt judge between Thy servants touching that whereon they are at variance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:47: If the evildoers possessed all that is in the earth, and the like of it with it, they would offer it to ransom themselves from the evil of the chastisement on the Day of Resurrection; yet there would appear to them from God that they never reckoned with,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:48: and there would appear to them die evils of that they have earned, and they would be encompassed by that they mocked at.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:49: When some affliction visits a man, he calls unto Us; then, when We confer on him a blessing from Us, he says, ’I was given it only because of a knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:50: So said those that were before them; but that they earned did not avail them,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:51: in that the evils of that they earned smote them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:52: Do they know that God outspreads and straitens His provision to whomsoever He will? Surely in that are signs for a people who believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:53: Say: ’O my people who have been prodigal against yourselves, do not despair of God’s mercy; surely God forgives sins altogether; surely He is the All-forgiving, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:54: Turn unto your Lord and surrender to Him, ere the chastisement comes upon you, then you will not be helped.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:55: And follow the fairest of what has been sent down to you from your Lord, ere the chastisement comes upon you suddenly while you are unaware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:56: Lest any soul should say, ’Alas for me, in that I neglected my duty to God, and was a scoffer,’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:57: or lest it should say, ’If only God had guided me, I should have been or lest among the godfearing,’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:58: it should say, when it sees the chastisement, ’O that I might return again, and be among the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:59: ’Yes indeed! My signs did come to thee, but thou hast cried them lies, and thou hast waxed proud, and become one of the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:60: And upon the Day of Resurrection thou shalt see those who lied against God, their faces blackened; is there not in Gehenna a lodging for those that are proud?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:61: But God shall deliver those that were godfearing in their security; evil shall not visit them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:62: God is the Creator of every thing; He is Guardian over every thing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:63: unto Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:64: Say: ’Is it other than God you bid me serve, you ignorant ones?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:65: It has been revealed to thee, and to those before thee, ’If thou associatest other gods with God, thy work shall surely fail and thou wilt be among the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:66: Nay, but God do thou serve; and be thou among the thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:67: They measure not God with His true measure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:68: For the Trumpet shall be blown, and whosoever is in the heavens and whosoever is in the earth shall swoon, save whom God wills.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:69: And the earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, and the Book shall be set in place, and the Prophets and witnesses shall be brought, and justly the issue be decided between them, and they not wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:70: Every soul shall be paid in full for what it has wrought; and He knows very well what they do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:71: Then the unbelievers shall be driven in companies into Gehenna till, when they have come thither, then its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them, ’Did not Messengers come to you from among yourselves, reciting to you the signs of your Lord and warning you against the encounter of this your day?’ They shall say, ’Yes indeed; but the word of the chastisement has been realized against the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:72: It shall be said, ’Enter the gates of Gehenna, to dwell therein forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:73: Then those that feared their Lord shall be driven in companies into Paradise, till, when they have come thither, and its gates are opened, and its keepers will say to them, ’Peace be upon you! Well you have fared; enter in, to dwell forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:74: And they shall say, ’Praise belongs to God, who has been true in His promise to us, and has bequeathed upon us the earth, for us to make our dwelling wheresoever we will in Paradise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 39:75: And thou shalt see the angels encircling about the Throne proclaiming the praise of their Lord; and justly the issue shall be decided between them; and it shall be said, ’Praise belongs to God, the Lord of all Being.

Muhammad Asad.verse 39:1: THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ issues from God, the Almighty, the Wise:
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:2: for, behold, it is We who have bestowed this revelation upon thee from on high, setting forth the truth: so worship God, sincere in thy faith in Him alone!
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:3: Is it not to God alone that all sincere faith is due? And yet, they who take for their protectors aught beside Him [are wont to say], "We worship them for no other reason than that they bring us nearer to God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:4: Had God willed to take unto Himself a son, He could have chosen anyone that He wanted out of whatever He has created –
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:5: limitless is He in His glory! He is the One God, the One who holds absolute sway over all that exists!
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:6: He it is who has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an inner] truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:8: out of one living entity, and out of it fashioned its mate; and he has bestowed upon you four kinds of cattle of either sex;
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:9: He creates you in your mothers’ wombs, one act of creation after another, in threefold depths of darkness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:10: If you are ingrate – behold, God has no need of you; none the less, He does not approve of ingratitude in His servants: whereas, if you show gratitude, He approves it in you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:11: understand all that you were doing [in life]: for, verily, He has full knowledge of what is in the hearts [of men].
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:12: NOW [thus it is:] when affliction befalls man, he is likely to cry out to his Sustainer, turning unto Him [for help]; but as soon as He has bestowed upon him a boon by His grace, he forgets Him whom he invoked before, and claims that there are other powers that could rival God – and thus leads
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:14: verily, thou art of those who are destined for the fire!
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:15: Or [dost thou deem thyself equal to] one who devoutly worships
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:16: throughout the night, prostrating himself or standing [in prayer], ever-mindful of the life to come, and hoping for his Sustainer’s grace?" Say: "Can they who know and they who do not know be deemed equal?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:17: only they who are endowed with insight keep this in mind!
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:18: Say: "[Thus speaks God:] ‘O you servants of Mine who have attained to faith! Be conscious of your Sustainer! Ultimate good awaits those who persevere in doing good in this world.
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:20: verily, they who are patient in adversity will be given their reward in full, beyond all reckoning!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:21: Say [O Muhammad]: "Behold, I am bidden to worship God, sincere in my faith in Him alone;
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:22: and I am bidden to be foremost among those who surrender themselves unto God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:23: Say: "Behold, I would dread, were I to rebel against my Sustainer, the suffering [which would befall me] on that awesome Day [of Judgment].
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:24: Say: "God alone do I worship, sincere in my faith in Him alone –
Muhammad Asad.verse 39:25: and [it is up to you, O sinners, to] worship whatever you please instead of Him!" Say: "Behold, the

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:1: This is the revelation of the Book from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:2: Surely We have revealed the Book to you with truth; so worship Allah making your submission exclusive for Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:3: Remember, Allah alone deserves the exclusive submission.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:4: Had Allah opted to have a son of His own, He would have definitely chosen anyone, as He wished, out of what He had created.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:5: He created the heavens and the earth for just purpose.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:6: He created you from a single person, then (once this person was created,) He made his match from him, and sent down for you eight pairs of the cattle.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:7: If you disbelieve, then, Allah does not need you at all, however He does not like for His servants to be disbelievers; and if you are grateful, He will like it for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:8: And when man is afflicted by pain, he calls his Lord turning to Him passionately.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:9: Can (such people be equal to) the one who worships during the hours of night, prostrating himself and standing, fearing the Hereafter and having hopes in his Lord’s mercy? Say, “Can those who know and those who do not know become equal?” It is only the people of understanding who are receptive of the advice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:10: Say (on My behalf) “O My servants who believe, fear your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:11: Say, “I have been ordered to worship Allah, making my submission exclusive to Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:12: And I have been ordered to be the first of those who submit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:13: Say, “If I were to disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a great day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:14: Say, “It is Allah whom I worship, making my submission exclusive to Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:15: So, worship what you wish other than Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:16: For them there are canopies of fire on top of them and canopies (of fire) underneath them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:17: And those who abstain from worshipping the Tāghūt and turn fervently to Allah, for them there is good news.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:18: who listen to what is said, then, follow the best of it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:19: So tell Me about the one for whom the word of punishment is destined, - is it you, then, who would save someone who is already in the Fire?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:20: But, for those who fear their Lord, there are chambers with chambers built on top of them, with rivers running from underneath them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:21: Have you not seen that Allah sent down water from the sky, then made it penetrate into the earth (and gush forth) in the form of springs? Then He brings forth with it crops of different colors, and afterwards they wither, and you see them turned yellow, then He makes them chaff.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:22: So I ask about a person whose heart Allah has opened up for Islam, and consequently he proceeds in a light from his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:23: Allah has sent down the best discourse, a book containing subjects resembling each other, mentioned again and again, shivered from which are the skins of those who have awe of their Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:24: Tell Me about the one who tries to save himself from the worst punishment with his face on the Day of Judgment, (whether he is equal to the one who is not liable to any punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:25: Those before them had also rejected (the messengers) and consequently, the punishment came upon them in a way that they had never imagined.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:26: Then Allah made them taste disgrace in the worldly life, and of course the punishment of the Hereafter is much greater.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:27: And We have cited for people all sorts of examples in this Qur’ān, so that they may receive the message
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:28: through an Arabic Qur’ān that has no digression (from the truth), so that they may be God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:29: Allah has given an example: There is a man (enslaved and) owned by some partners having rivalry with each other, and (on the other hand,) there is a man solely owned by a single man.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:30: Verily, you are to die and they are to die.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:31: After that, on the Day of Doom, you will surely place your disputes before your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:32: So, who is more unjust than him who forges a lie against Allah and rejects the truth when it reached him? Is it not that in Jahannam (Hell) there is an abode for the disbelievers?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:33: As for the one who has come with the truth and believed it to be true, then such people are the ones who are God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:34: For them, with their Lord, there is what they wish.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:35: so that Allah wipes out from them the worst deeds they did, and gives their reward to them for the best of what they used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:36: Is Allah not sufficient for (the protection of) His slave? They are frightening you of those (false gods whom they worship) other than Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:37: And whomsoever Allah gives guidance, for him there is no one to misguide.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:38: If you ask them as to who created the heavens and the earth, they will certainly say, “Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:39: Say, “O my people, do at your place (what you are doing).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:40: as to who will be visited by a punishment that will disgrace him, and upon whom a lasting punishment will rest.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:41: We have sent down to you the Book for the people with truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:42: Allah fully takes away the souls (of the people) at the time of their death, and (of) those who do not die, in their sleep.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:43: Is it that they have adopted intercessors out of those (whom they invoke) other than Allah? Say, “(Do you take them as intercessors) even though they have no power at all, nor do they understand?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:45: When Allah is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter are filled with disgust, and when those (whom they worship) other than Him are mentioned, they become happy forthwith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:46: Say, “O Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, the Knower of the unseen and the seen, you will judge between Your servants in that about which they used to differ.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:47: Were the wrongdoers to own all that is on earth, and even twice as much, they would surely seek to ransom themselves with it against the evil punishment on the Day of Judgment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:48: Unveiled to them will be the evils of what they used to earn; and encircled they will be by what they used to ridicule.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:49: When man is visited by a trouble, he prays to Us, but when, after that, We favor him with some blessing from Us, he says, “This is given to me because of (my) knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:50: The same was said by those before them, but what they used to earn was of no avail to them,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:51: and they were overtaken by the evils of what they had earned; and the wrongdoers from these (infidels too) will be overtaken by the evils of what they have earned - and they will not be able to escape.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:52: Do they not know that it is Allah who extends provision to whomsoever He wills, and straitens (it for whomsoever He wills).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:53: Say (on My behalf), “O servants of Mine who have acted recklessly against their own selves, do not despair of Allah’s mercy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:54: Turn passionately towards your Lord, and submit to Him before the punishment comes to you, after which you will not be helped.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:55: And follow the best of what has been sent down to you from your Lord before the punishment comes to you suddenly when you do not even expect,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:56: lest someone should say, “Pity on me, because I fell short in respect of (observing the rights of) Allah and in fact, I was one of those who mocked”,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:57: or, (lest) someone should say, “If Allah were to show me the way, I would have surely been among those who fear Allah”,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:58: or, (lest) someone should say when he sees the punishment, “Would that I have a chance to return, so that I may become one of those who are good in their deeds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:59: No! My verses had reached you, but you called them untrue, and waxed proud, and became of those who disbelieved.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:60: And on the Day of Judgment, you will see those who had forged lies against Allah (in a state) that their faces are turned black.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:61: And Allah will save the God-fearing (from Jahannam ), with utmost success granted to them, so as no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:62: Allah is Creator of everything, and He is the Guardian over everything.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:63: To Him belong the keys to the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:64: Say, “Is it, then, someone other than Allah that you ask me to worship, O ignorant people?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:65: It has already been revealed to you and to those before you (that): If you associate (partners with Allah), your deeds shall be rendered useless, and you shall be among the losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:66: On the contrary, it is Allah whom you should worship; and be among the grateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:67: They did not hold Allah in His true esteem.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:68: And Horn (Sūr ) will be blown, and all those in the heavens and all those in the earth will faint, except the one whom Allah wills (otherwise).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:69: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the book (of everyone’s deeds) will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and matters will be decided between them with justice, and they will not be wronged.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:70: And everyone will be paid in full for what he did - and He knows best what they do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:71: Those who disbelieved will be driven towards Jahannam in groups, until when they reach it, its gates will be opened, and its keepers will say to them, “Did messengers from among you not come to you reciting to you the verses of your Lord, and warning you about the meeting of this day of yours?” They will say, “Yes (they did),but the word of punishment had become certain against those who disbelieved.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:72: It will be said, “Enter the gates of Jahannam to live in it forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:73: And those who used to fear their Lord will be led towards Jannah (Paradise) in groups, until when they reach it, while its gates will be (already) opened (for them), and its keepers will say to them, “Salāmun-’alaikum (peace be on you).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:74: And they will say, “AlHamdulillāh : Praise belongs to Allah who made His promise come true for us, and made us inherit the territory, so as we can dwell anywhere we wish in Jannah (Paradise) .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 39:75: And you will see the angels ringed around the Throne proclaiming the purity of their Lord, along with His praise, and matters will stand settled between them rightfully, and it will be said: “AlHamdulillāhi-rabbil‘ālamīn : Praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
